Transcript: Richard: Any word on Will or Alonzo?

Cassie: Not since you left to give blood. I 
just wish someone would come out and tell us what's going on.

Richard: Dr. Ramsey said it's going to take 
some time.

Cassie: She also said that the liver graft is 
a complicated procedure, and Will, he's so weak, and with Alonzo's condition...

Richard: There's a lot to worry about. I'm 
afraid as difficult as it sounds, all we can do right now is wait.

Cassie: Wait. And pray that nothing goes 
wrong.
(Country music playing)
Lorelei: The kids okay?

Harley: Well, mine are asleep. And Lizzie and 
James are entertaining Holly with the story of their "Hansel and Gretel" 
escapade. Where's my father?

Buzz: Right here. Rick and Phillip aren't 
back yet?
Harley: No, no. What is all this.
Lorelei: It's grub.

Buzz: While you were upstairs taking care of 
the kids, Beth and I suddenly realized that...

Lorelei: That we hadn't eaten all day, and 
hey, you know me, I'd have to be pretty worried to forget about food, huh.

Harley: Actually, you used to eat like a 
bird, but okay.

Lorelei: So, Buzz, you get all the fixings 
for that chili?
Buzz: Sure do. I got it here.
Lorelei: Great. Cornbread?
Buzz: Yes, ma'am.

Lorelei: Okay. Well, this is turning into a 
real celebration, huh? You know, I am just so darn happy that those kids are 
back that I just want to share it with... Hey. Hey, why don't you invite Frank 
up, and Rick's family, too, huh?

Harley: That's actually a pretty interesting 
idea.

Buzz: Oh, yeah. The more the merrier. Let's 
just totally ruin my romantic weekend with Holly.

Harley: Dad. Just let it go. The weekend is 
already blown, and Beth actually has a pretty good idea here, I think. You don't 
hear me say that too often. We have a reason to celebrate: The kids.
Lorelei: That's the spirit.
Harley: Yeah.

Lorelei: Hey, come on, you know, just... I'll 
chop what needs chopping. Come on, handsome, go on. I'm going to turn up the 
music.
Harley: Just a little.

Lorelei: And Phillip and Rick had better get 
back here soon or they're just going to miss all the fun.

Harley: Phillip and Rick. Phillip and Rick-- 
where are they?
Phillip: I can't believe we're lost.

Rick: Neither can I. Hey... hey! We agree on 
something! What are you doing? What are you doing?
Phillip: I'm calling Beth.

Rick: We're men. We cannot admit to a woman 
we're lost.

Phillip: Rick, I am so tired, I have no 
pride.

Rick: Oh, great. In that case... Oh, this is 
great. My phone's dead, too.

Phillip: Doesn't matter; I have a signal. 
Beth?
Lorelei: Phillip, is that you?
Phillip: Uh, yeah. Beth, I...

Lorelei: Hold on a minute, let me turn down 
the music.

Phillip: Listen, I got a bad signal here. Oh, 
damn it.

Rick: Oh, well, they don't call it the 
boonies for nothing. Why don't you move over here? Try it over here.
Phillip: Shh. Beth.
Lorelei: Phillip, I can hardly hear you.

Phillip: Yeah, I know. I can't hear you well, 
either. We have a bad signal. Damn it.
Rick: Would you just move over here.
Phillip: Would you be quiet?
Rick: You're not getting a signal there.

Phillip: The phone says I have a signal, 
Rick.

Rick: The phone is lying. The first time you 
got through to Beth, you were standing right here.

Phillip: Yes. Why do you think I moved from 
over there, Rick? Because the signal was breaking up.

Rick: It was breaking up, but at least you 
have a signal. Over there it's dead as a doornail.
Phillip: Shut up.

Rick: Phillip, would you please just move 
over here.
Phillip: Rick. Rick.

Rick: Give me the phone, I'll tell you what 
I'm talking about. Will you stop being stupid. (Struggling) nice job. You are 
really unbelievable.
Phillip: Idiot!
Rick: Great job.

Phillip: Oh, that's good, Rick. That's good. 
You know how the phone wasn't working very well over here? Well, now it's not 
working at all.

Phoebe: I guess you'll have to wait until dinner to meet the children. Master 
Rupert, he's a handful. Miss Esme, she's all right. Did you just make the 
crossing? From the states?

Reva: Uh, uh-huh. Phoebe, this painting... 
Where did you get it?

Phoebe: That one. It's been in the house 
since I come here.
Reva: Mm. Why doesn't it hang on the wall?

Phoebe: Because the mistress, she's having it 
fixed. Restored, she says. It's old. I think it's from America someplace.

Reva: I'm so thirsty. Would you mind terribly 
getting me something to drink. A soda would be fine.
Phoebe: A soda? Ah, a soda water.
Reva: (Laughs) yeah, a soda water.
Phoebe: I'll get it myself. You sit and rest.

Reva: Okay. I've got to get... I've got to 
get back to Jack before it's too late. Oh. Oh!
John: Well, now. What's your hurry, lass?
Reva: Joshua?

Phoebe: John! There's a servant's entrance 
for a reason. Sir Arthur will have your head.

John: And who will tell him, fair Phoebe? 
Hmm? Not I. Will you, miss?

Phoebe: Give me those, and get your muddy 
boots off me carpet.

John: John Macgregor at your service, ma'am. 
I'm the gameskeeper here at Thornwood. You must be the new governess.
Reva: I guess I must.
John: Well, are you or aren't you?
Reva: Yes, I am.

John: And do you have a name, or are you 
uncertain about that, as well?
Reva: It's Reva. Reva Shayne.

John: Oh, another American import to the 
Manor, though not quite as formal as the first. Were you a governess in America, 
as well?

Reva: Yes, I was, among other things. Mr. 
Macgregor, have you worked here long? Mr. Macgregor?

John: Aye. I'm sorry for staring, ma'am, but 
the strangest feeling just came over me. You seem so familiar, as if I've stood 
in this very spot with you before and gazed into your eyes. Have we met before?
Reva: Yes, we have. Many times.

Josh: Well, assuming Reva's flight left on time, I guess she's on her way to the 
clinic right about now.

Olivia: I can't believe she agreed to go, 
especially on her own.

Josh: Well, I didn't offer to take her, and 
she didn't ask. I think she really understands now that this is... It's over, 
you know, this codependency we've had, whatever you want to call it, it's done. 
She's on her own now. Wow. Boy, you know, I didn't mean to make that sound so 
cold. It's not that I want to turn my back on Reva, I just want to...

Olivia: You just want to maintain a healthy 
balance, maybe give other aspects of your life their proper due.
Josh: Yeah. Like you.

Olivia: She's always been between us, Josh, 
whether you knew it or not.

Josh: Well, that's done. It's over. A whole 
new chapter now we're writing. Right now I want to focus on other things-- on 
our marriage and on the business.

Olivia: Making the harbor project a huge 
success.
Josh: Yeah, well, that's just the first step.
Olivia: Really?

Josh: Mm, yeah. Really. Hey, look, you've 
been talking to me about taking more risks, right?
Olivia: Uh-huh.

Josh: Smart risks. Well, I've heard what 
you've been saying and so has Billy.
Olivia: What does that mean?

Josh: We're working on a little something on 
the side. In fact, Billy's on the horn right now, he's trying to make it happen.

Olivia: You're going to tell me about it, 
right?

Josh: No, ma'am. No, I'm not going to tell 
you about it. I'll tell you what, I'll give you a hint, though, okay? If... if 
this deal works out how I expect, everyone involved in the harbor project will 
get exactly what they deserve, and then some.
Edmund: Beth?

Lorelei: Eddie? I mean, Edmund, I told you 
not to call me again.
Edmund: Where are you, Lorelei?
Lorelei: That's none of your business.

Edmund: Don't tell me you're playing footsie 
with Phillip at the Inn?
Buzz: Harley, where's the salt?

Edmund: Is that Buzz cooper's voice? Are you 
still at that Godforsaken cabin?

Lorelei: I know that you stranded us up here. 
I'm going to hang up now. I'm going to hang up now because Phillip is trying to 
get through and he's out in the woods.
Edmund: In the woods? It's pitch dark.
Lorelei: I know that.

Edmund: What on earth is Phillip doing in the 
woods? (Laughs) oh, don't tell me he's lost.
Lorelei: Don't be ridiculous.

Edmund: Phillip Spaulding lost in the woods. 
Well, there is a God.

Lorelei: Hey, I hate to admit this, but 
Edmund said something that made sense. Do you think Phillip and Rick could be 
lost?
Harley: (Scoffs) lost? No way.

Lorelei: Well, you know, they're barely 
speaking to each other, and why else would they be out in the woods together 
this long unless they didn't have a choice.
Buzz: She has a point.

Harley: Yeah. Well, why don't you try him on 
your cell phone?
Lorelei: I can't get through.
Harley: What?
Lorelei: No.
Harley: Fine. I'll go out and look for them.

Lorelei: Okay, I'll come with you. You know, 
two voices yelling are louder than one.
Buzz: She has a point.

Harley: And I'll take my cell phone, and 
we'll obviously need flashlights, right? And dad, where's that compass that you 
were using earlier?
Buzz: Oh, here.
Harley: Thanks.
Buzz: Want me to come?

Harley: Oh, no. No, no, no. Thank you, but 
besides the kids, why should we all be miserable? Thanks.
Lorelei: Wow, you like country music?
Rick: All right, come on. Get on your feet, let's go.
Phillip: Go where?
Rick: Anywhere is better than this place.
Phillip: Not as far as I'm concerned.

Rick: Okay. Fine, fine. You just stay where 
you are; I'm leaving.
Phillip: Good. Not a moment too soon.

Rick: So, what... Are you going to sit on the 
rock all night long? Is that what you're going to do?
Phillip: Yep.

Rick: And what do you think that's going to 
accomplish?

Phillip: A lot. The most important thing it 
will accomplish is for a few blessed hours I won't have to listen to your yap.

Rick: Hmm. Well, it looks like you're going 
to be stuck with me either way, pal, because neither one of us are going 
anywhere until we hash this thing out. All of it.
Harley: Rick!

Lorelei: Phillip! Oh, oh, oh, oh. (Laughs) 
thanks.
Harley: No problem.
Lorelei: You know, you're good at this.
Harley: At what?

Lorelei: You know, being calm, in control. I 
guess that's probably your police training. You're just really good at making 
people feel safe.
Harley: Hey, Beth?
Lorelei: Yeah.
Harley: Why are you being so nice to me?

Lorelei: What, I shouldn't be? Phillip? Has 
Phillip always been the problem between us?

Harley: Do you really want me to answer 
that... Look, Beth... You know what, never mind.
Lorelei: No, wait a minute. Stop, stop. What?
Harley: You've had a serious head injury.

Lorelei: You know, I had a bump on the head, 
and it's making me think a lot more clearly now, so come on, say whatever's on 
your mind. Just get it out of your system and let's be done with it.

Harley: Oh, I don't think we could be "done 
with it."

Lorelei: Well, no, not at the rate you're 
going, we won't. No, we won't. But come on. What, what? You don't think that I 
can take it? I'm not as fragile as you think I am.

Harley: Oh, believe me, I am the one person 
who knows you're not fragile, who knows that you are the opposite of fragile.

Lorelei: Okay, okay, okay. So tell me. Tell 
me all the reasons that you hate me. Unless... unless, of course, you don't have 
the guts.

Harley: Don't have the guts? Okay. Okay. You 
want to hear this, Beth? Fine. You asked for it.
Phillip: No. I am not going to do this right now.
Rick: Oh? Why not?
Phillip: Because I don't want to.

Rick: Yes, you do. Yes, you do. You want to 
lay into me, pal, so go ahead. Lay into me. Let me have it. Go ahead. Come on! 
Oh, you know what? First you want to stay, now you want to leave. Why don't you 
just make up your mind there, cowboy?
Phillip: Hey, Rick?
Rick: What?
Phillip: Go to hell.
Rick: You're an idiot.
Phillip: (Yells in pain)
Rick: Phillip?
Phillip: Damn it.
Rick: What happened?
Phillip: Damn it.
Rick: What happened?

Phillip: I hit that damn stump and I turned 
my ankle.
Rick: Let me see it.
Phillip: Just get away from me.
Rick: I'm a doctor, let me see it.

Phillip: Ow! That's good, Rick. Why don't you 
push a little harder?

Rick: Is this the same one you sprained last 
winter.

Phillip: That's good. They gave you a license 
for that?

Rick: Well, it's not broken. It's a bad 
sprain. Think you can get on your feet and walk?
Phillip: Don't bother helping me. (Grunts)

Rick: Well, there you go. Looks like you have 
no other choice but to talk about this.
Richard: So he's... Well, he's in surgery now.

Dax: Surgery? Did you get a chance to speak 
to Alonzo before he went in? Was he in good spirits? Optimistic? A good mental 
state is vital for a positive outcome in these situations.

Cassie: He seemed like he was in good 
spirits, I guess.
Dax: How long has he been in there?
Richard: Dax?
Dax: Yes?

Richard: Don't get me wrong or anything, it's 
very compassionate of you, but why are you getting so worked up about Alonzo? I 
mean, you don't know the man, really, do you?

Dax: I don't, but I know of him. And from 
everything I've observed, he's exceedingly decent and of very strong character. 
He's certainly done right by you and Cassie, and Will now, too.

Richard: Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey. You all 
right?

Cassie: Yeah, I'm just... just really 
light-headed, that's all.
Richard: You sure?
Cassie: Yeah.

Richard: Dax, she hasn't eaten since 
breakfast. Would you mind terribly running over to Company and, I don't know, 
getting a sandwich or something?
Dax: Not at all. I'm glad to be of service.
Richard: Thank you, Dax.
John: Where did we meet, then? Edinburgh? London?
Reva: Somewhere else?
John: Where?
Reva: Far away. In another lifetime.
John: Pardon?

Reva: You know that feeling you had, that 
we'd met before? The French call it déja vu-- "already seen." Have you ever felt 
that before?

John: Perhaps I have. But not quite so 
strong.

Reva: Well, there are people who believe that 
déja vu is only an illusion, or a trick of the mind, but then there are those 
people who believe we have met before, in a previous lifetime. And the theory is 
that life doesn't begin with birth and end with death. That it's a cycle, a 
circle that goes around and around.
John: Hmm. Is that what you believe, then?

Reva: Well, I think that there's a reason for 
everything, and I think there's a reason why I wound up here with you, and why 
you look so much like someone I know.
John: Who? An American?
Reva: A colonel in our Civil War.

John: Oh, he must be 60 years old. I remind 
you of someone that old, do I?

Reva: Oh, no, no. No, no, no, no, no. In 
fact, I haven't actually met... met him. I've just seen pictures of him. When he 
was much younger. (Laughs)
John: He must be a handsome devil.

Reva: Yeah, very. So, Mr. Macgregor, tell me 
about yourself. Have you worked here for a while?
John: Since before his lordship was married.

Reva: Hmm. Do you have any idea where that 
painting came from?
Constance: I do. She was my mother.

John: I beg your pardon, Lady Thornwood. We 
did not hear you come in.

Constance: Is that mud on your boots, John? 
And you-- you must be the new governess.
Reva: Yes, I am, ma'am.

Constance: M'lady. Lady Constance Thornwood. 
And your name is?
Reva: Uh, Reva, m'lady.
Constance: Oh, American.
Reva: Uh-huh.

Constance: Well, unlike America, we here in 
England still stand on ceremony. We don't make ourselves at home in someone 
else's home unless we're invited to.

John: That's my fault, m'lady. Phoebe was 
giving her a tour of the house and I detained her.
Constance: Why is that?

John: She seemed familiar to me. I was trying 
to place her, ma'am.
Constance: Did you?
John: No. It's still a mystery.

Constance: Well, you'll meet my son and 
daughter at dinner. Meanwhile, you may retire to your quarters.
Reva: Yes... M'lady.

Constance: John, you remain. I need a word 
with you, please.

Reva: Excuse me, Lady Thornwood. This 
portrait-- of Regina Robechaux-- she was your mother?

Constance: Yes, yes. Though I never knew her. 
She died giving birth to me. How did you know her name?

Reva: Um, I lived in New Orleans a week... A 
while. (Laughs) and I actually worked for ancestors of the Robechaux... But 
Jack Robechaux wasn't your father?

Constance: No, Jack Robechaux died... He was 
executed before my birth. My mother remarried. Anything else?
Reva: No. Thank you.
John: I apologize for my boots, ma'am.

Constance: It's no matter, John. It's merely 
evidence of how hard you work. It's a lovely night, isn't it?
John: Indeed.

Constance: Too lovely to spend inside. Maybe 
you should take me for that ride you are always promising me. You could show me 
the trail to the abandoned cottage.

John: I'm afraid I can't do that, ma'am. His 
lordship has me busy with chores.

Constance: You certainly found time to 
entertain the new governess.

John: I was just welcoming her, ma'am. And 
now I'm off my schedule.

Constance: Oh, John. All work and no play 
makes you a very dull boy. Take me for the ride. I'm sure there's some things 
you can show me. I know the reverse is true.

Harley: And Jim-- Jim was absolutely devastated. Devastated. But he took you 
back, Beth. He took you back and he made James his own little child. But was 
that enough for you? Oh, no, of course not. You went running back to Phillip 
every little chance you could get. You insinuated yourself into my marriage-- 
well, what was left of it at that point. You didn't stop there; you went back 
even after Jim had died in the fire. You went back even after you had married 
Edmund.
Lorelei: Okay. Go on. Don't stop there.

Rick: Boy, talk about a captive audience. If I wanted to give you what- for, now 
would be the perfect time to do it, wouldn't it?

Phillip: You know what, Rick? Your bedside 
manner stinks.

Rick: Tough. Because you know something, pal? 
You're not going anywhere and we have no other choice but to talk about this.

Harley: It was always about you, Beth. It was always about you and your 
insecurities, I should say. Well, it's a big planet out there, okay? There are a 
lot of people here and other people have feelings, you know what I mean?

Lorelei: Boy. Wow, yeah, I get it. I get it. 
I see why you're so angry, and I’m sorry.
Harley: Please.

Lorelei: No, I am, I am. And the only thing 
that I can say in my defense is... Well, there's nothing really that I can say 
in my defense. Except it does take two, and I couldn't have played Phillip like 
that unless on some level he wanted it, too.
Harley: Exactly. Which is why I divorced him.

Lorelei: Did you sleep with Rick to get back 
at Phillip?

Harley: (Scoffs) no. No, that is not why 
that happened, okay. Not that Phillip would ever believe that, but no.

Lorelei: But come on, on some level, you and 
Rick must have known what you were doing.

Harley: Rick was drunk and I was hurting, and 
it just happened. It just happened.

Lorelei: Things like that don't just happen. 
Come on. (Laughs)
Harley: Well... well, it did.

Lorelei: Okay. Okay. You know, it sounds kind 
of like Phillip and me on the plane, to me. And, well, you didn't tell the truth 
right away, either. I mean, Rick wanted to, just like Phillip wanted to, but you 
didn't. Why is that?

Harley: (Laughs weakly) you know what? It 
doesn't matter.

Lorelei: No, it doesn't, does it? Because 
really there is no excuse, for either of us. Maybe we should just accept that 
and, I don't know, let it go?
Rick: You're so damn stubborn. Why won't you talk to me?

Phillip: Because it won't be talking, Rick. 
It will be more lecturing from you about how great you are and what a jerk I am.
Harley: All right, we've really got to find these guys.

Rick: (Faintly) well, sometimes you are a 
jerk.
Lorelei: Did you just hear that?

Rick: You can be a complete, class "A" jerk 
sometimes.
Harley: That's Rick.
Phillip: And you are self- righteous...

Harley: And Phillip. And they're fighting. 
Let's go.

Lorelei: No, no, no, no, no, no, no. Wait, 
wait. You know, we know where they are, so why don't we just let them hash it 
out. I mean, it worked for us, right? Hmm?

Rick: I am not superior, but you know what? 
You keep insisting I am. For some insane reason you expect me to live up to some 
standard of perfection that no mortal could possibly obtain!

Phillip: Well, you know what? You're right, 
Rick. I do expect you to be perfect. You want to know why I expect you to be 
perfect?
Rick: Give me a clue.

Phillip: Because you love it so much, Rick. 
You wouldn't have it any other way.
Josh: We're on the same page, then.
Man: Same sentence, same word.

Josh: You guarantee you'll step in before any 
corporate secrets can be compromised.
Man: Just tell us when.
Josh: Okay.
Olivia: Josh? Hi, you left the door open.

Josh: Hi. Yes. This is Dan Meyer. He lives 
down the block.
Olivia: Hello.

Josh: This is my wife, Olivia Lewis. Dan just 
stopped in because he heard about Reva. He wanted to know if there's anything he 
could do, and I appreciate that, I really do. As I said to you before, I’ll keep 
you posted.
Man: Please do.
Josh: Okay, thanks.
Man: Nice meeting you, Mrs. Lewis.
Olivia: You, too.
Josh: You...
Man: I know the way out.
Josh: Yes, okay. So, what are you doing here?

Olivia: Well, you didn't think you could get 
me hot and bothered, then run out on me, do you?
Josh: Hot and bothered?

Olivia: Yeah. You know business is a big 
turn- on for me, and the prospect of Lewis going public, that is a mega, mega 
turn-on.

Josh: Just a minute. Just a minute, now. You 
did not hear that from my lips.

Olivia: Speaking of lips, you know what's 
sexy? Is when you have a secret. You know what's even sexier? Getting it out of 
you.

Richard: The nurse said that they finished in the OR, so someone's going to be 
out here very shortly to give us a full report.

Edmund: May I stay with you until then? Dax 
told me about your son. I'm terribly sorry. If there's anything I can do.

Richard: Don't you think you've done enough 
already, Edmund?

Edmund: Richard, let us put aside our 
differences for one evening. All that matters is the child.

Cassie: How can you say that with a straight 
face?

Richard: Have you no shame? You've already 
taken one child away from us, so what on earth makes you think that we would 
want you around while we wait on the fate of another?

Edmund: Fine, if this is the way you want it. 
But I wonder what it says about the three of us when I’m capable of change and 
growth and you're not.
Claire: Oh.
Richard: Doctor.

Claire: There you are. Good news: Will is in 
post-op and he came through with flying colors.
Cassie: Oh, God!
Richard: Thank God.
Cassie: Um...
Richard: Alonzo.

Claire: Alonzo, yes. Alonzo is another story. 
Unfortunately, there were complications.
Richard: His condition.

Claire: Well, yeah, it's been touch and go. 
He might not come through.

Rick: That's ridiculous. That is... That is absolutely ridiculous. The last 
thing I would want would be for you or anybody else to think that I'm perfect. 
That is the last thing in the world I would want from anybody!
Phillip: Really?
Rick: Really.

Phillip: Really? (Scoffs) well, Rick, 
you're such a good guy, man. Isn't that what people always tell you? Haven't 
they been telling you that your whole life? Good old Rick. Good old, 
self-sacrificing, long-suffering Rick, always there with a shoulder to cry on, a 
sympathetic ear.
Rick: What's wrong with that?

Phillip: Well, nothing, obviously. Clearly 
nothing, Rick, because it's obviously working for you. Look at all the strokes 
you get for it. Look at all the sympathy that you get in return-- that's my 
favorite part. When Abby left you, what did everybody say? They said, "poor 
Rick." They said, "doggone that Abby, how could she do that to good old Rick?" I 
don't think I've heard anybody say a word about anything that you might have 
done to contribute to your marriage falling apart. No, we didn't hear anything 
like that. Or-- hey, this is even better, this is right on point-- how about 
when you slept with Blake. Remember Ross's wife? What did people say then? 
Again, it was "poor Rick. It was, "well, you know what, he was probably drunk, 
and you know Blake, she probably made him do it." Well, I got news for you, 
Rick.
Rick: What is it?

Phillip: Nobody made you do any of it. You 
screwed up all on your own.
Rick: I never said that I did, did I?

Phillip: You don't have to, Rick, because 
everybody else says it for you. It's okay. It works for you, man. It works. God 
knows it would never work for me, because if I look at somebody funny, I hear 
about it from everybody for years. But you, you can screw up all you want and 
you come out smelling like a rose because you're good old Rick. You're good old 
Rick! You're compassionate. You're understanding-- to everybody except me.
Rick: Oh, here we go.
Phillip: Because...
Rick: Here we go. Here comes the martyr act.

Phillip: That's right, yeah. No, no. This is 
where you're actually going to find out the truth, Rick, because when I screw 
up, when I commit the monumental screw-up of sleeping with Beth in the plane-- 
when I think I'm dying, by the way-- do I get the understanding? Do I get the 
compassion? No! No, that sin, somehow, is unforgivable.
Rick: I never said that!

Phillip: You didn't have to say it! You sided 
with Harley!
Rick: I did not!

Phillip: Oh, the hell you didn't! You did and 
you know it. You had the choice of sticking by me-- your lifelong friend-- or 
going for a few more strokes. So what did you do? Oh, hell, you went for the 
strokes. In my bed!
Rick: Your wife needed a friend!

Phillip: My wife... Did you just say my wife 
needed a friend? I needed a friend, Rick. She's got friends; she's got family. 
All I had was you. And then... I know I have screwed up more than my share in 
the years that we have been friends, but damn it, Rick, when push came to shove, 
right or wrong, I have always stood by you. And when it was your turn to do that 
for me, you...

Rick: I let you down. Right? Because despite 
everything you just said, you do expect me to be different, because God knows 
everybody else in your life has let you down in one way or the other. Let's list 
them out, shall we? Alan, Justin, Jackie. Beth when she divorced you. It's been 
one disappointment after another. You don't think I know that? I felt the pain 
right along with you! And with each betrayal you suffered, you kept pressuring 
me more and more to be...
Phillip: Pressuring you?

Rick: ...The perfect friend! Oh, yeah. Even 
though you took Beth from me, and Mindy and Meredith. Even though you had the 
wife and kids that I've always wanted but never had. You know, I was supposed to 
be the perfect friend through all of that! Oh, no! Yeah, but at least I forgave 
you!
Phillip: You did?

Rick: We have different standards from 
everybody else.
Phillip: You forgave me?
Rick: What?
Phillip: You forgave me?
Rick: Yes.
Phillip: You sure?

Rick: I... Maybe I haven't. All those years 
that I came in second, I don't know, maybe for once I just wanted you to lose. 
I'm sorry.

Phillip: Well, I'm glad to see you're having 
as much fun being me as I am being you.

Rick: Maybe this is the time for us to find a 
way to forgive each other. We can start over. Not where we were, but I don't 
know, someplace different. Someplace better.

Buzz: There you are. What have you guys been 
doing out here all this time?

Phillip: Waiting for you to show up. It took 
you long enough. You know the way back?
Buzz: Yeah. What happened?

Phillip: Nothing. I don't want to talk about 
it. Let's go.
Buzz: Okay.
Constance: Just a quick canter down to the cottage and back.
John: I can't, ma'am. My chores.

Constance: I'll be sure to tell sir Arthur 
how devoted you are to your work.

John: Thank you, ma'am. You can come out now. 
Got an earful, did you?
Reva: It was wrong of me to eavesdrop.

John: It certainly was. But I'm grateful to 
have a witness.
Reva: Is she always that bold with you?

John: Oh, that's not the half of it, ma'am. I 
don't know what Lord Arthur sees in her-- except the obvious.

Reva: Well, for most men that would be quite 
enough.

John: Not for me, ma'am. No. When I take a 
wife, it will be for more lasting reasons. The woman I choose will be warm and 
kind, and honest, wise. Someone I can laugh with and share the better things in 
life with. The forest, the stars, children, and love. She'll be...
Reva: Your soul-mate?
John: Aye. That she will. Miss Shayne.
Reva: Reva.

John: Reva. Reva. It is a beautiful night 
out. May I take you for a stroll in the garden before I tend to my chores? I'd 
like to learn more about America, and more about you as well.

Reva: Uh, it's a really lovely offer, but 
it's one that I’m going to have to turn down. Because I don't think it's proper, 
if you understand.

John: Aye. I understand. You are educated. 
I'm just a gameskeeper.

Reva: Oh, no. No, no, no, that's not what I 
meant at all.

John: I don't know what I would have to offer 
a woman such as yourself. I apologize for my forwardness, ma'am. I won't make 
the same mistake again.
Olivia: You know what comes next?
Josh: Here?

Olivia: Here, there, anywhere. You've shown 
me how much you love me. Now I'm going to show you.
Josh: Olivia.
Olivia: I want you. So much.
Josh: No. No, I can't do this.
Olivia: Why? What's wrong?
Josh: This is.
